description: Borrowed from Spanish patata, itself borrowed from Ta√≠no batata.

adjectives.description: potato (comparative more potato, superlative most potato)

entries.meaning: (computing, slang, humorous, of a computing device) Underpowered; low-end.
examples: I'd've captured a video of my playthrough rather than just screenshots, but my computer's too potato to comfortably run the game and a video-capture program at the same time.

entries.meaning: The tuber of a plant, Solanum tuberosum, eaten as a starchy vegetable, particularly in the Americas and Europe; this plant.
(informal, UK) A conspicuous hole in a sock or stocking.

definitionGroups.group: Metaphor for a person or thing of little value.

entries.meaning: (humorous) A camera that takes poor-quality pictures.
(humorous, slang, computing) An underpowered computer or other device, especially when small in size.
